headline: Gov. DeWine tests positive for COVID-19
author: Schalischa Petit-De
sentences: According to the governor’s Twitter account, DeWine was diagnosed with COVID after experiencing mild symptoms including a runny nose, headache, body aches and a sore throat.
Both the governor and the first lady had been previously exposed to COVID-19 in November 2021 and December 2021.
DeWine is currently in quarantine and received a monoclonal antibody treatment early Friday evening.
First Lady Fran DeWine tested negative and has not experienced any COVID-19 symptoms.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WDTN) – Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has tested positive for COVID-19.
